intro: Chenopodium venturii, commonly known as desert goosefoot, is a flowering plant native to arid and semi-arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual that typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring succulent, lobed leaves that are adapted to conserve water. The plant produces small, greenish-yellow flowers in clusters, which are followed by small, rounded fruits. It thrives in sandy or gravelly soils and is often found in disturbed areas such as roadsides and dry fields. Chenopodium venturii is well-suited to drought conditions and plays a role in stabilizing soils in its native habitat.
